Empires Rise, Echoes Remain

Iron crowns rust in the mouths of forgotten godswhile silk roads unravel into dust
Legions march on ghostly tread,their banners stitched with stolen dawns
Gold turns to lead in the vaults of time,weighing down the scales of hollow thrones
The scent of myrrh lingerswhere libraries burned to ash—ink bleeding into the cracks of history
Monuments crumble like sugar in rain,their shadows still stretching over starving fields
